problem.prob_desc:
30. 좌표평면에 한 변의 길이가 4인 정삼각형 $\mathrm{ABC}$가 있다. 선분 $\mathrm{AB}$를 1:3으로 내분하는 점을 $\mathrm{D}$, 선분 $\mathrm{BC}$를 1:3으로 내분하는 점을 $\mathrm{E}$, 선분 $\mathrm{CA}$를 1:3으로 내분하는 점을 $\mathrm{F}$라 하자. 네 점 $\mathrm{P,\ Q,\ R,\ X}$가 다음 조건을 만족시킨다.
> (가) $|\overrightarrow{DP}| = |\overrightarrow{EQ}| = |\overrightarrow{FR}| = 1$
> (나) $\overrightarrow{AX} = \overrightarrow{PB}+\overrightarrow{QC}+\overrightarrow{RA}$
$|\overrightarrow{AX}|$의 값이 최대일 때, 삼각형 $\mathrm{PQR}$의 넓이를 $S$라 하자. $16S^2$의 값을 구하시오. [4점]

gpt-5-codex.title: Maximize |AX| condition
gpt-5-codex.body: Write P=D+u, Q=E+v, R=F+w with |u|=|v|=|w|=1. From AX=PB+QC+RA we get AX=(B+C)-(P+Q+R)=(B+C)-(D+E+F)-(u+v+w). Since B+C=D+E+F, we have AX=-(u+v+w). As u+v+w can be any vector of magnitude ≤3, the maximum |AX| is 3, achieved when u=v=w are the same unit vector.

gpt-5-codex.title: Compute area of triangle DEF
gpt-5-codex.body: With u=v=w, triangle PQR is a translation of triangle DEF, so its area equals area(DEF). Using D as origin for vectors, DE=(2.5, √3/2), DF=(0.5, 1.5√3); the cross product magnitude is 2.5·1.5√3−(√3/2)·0.5=3.5√3, giving area S=½·3.5√3=7√3/4. Hence 16S²=16·(49/16)·3=147.

gpt-5.title: Rewrite AX via positions
gpt-5.body: Using position vectors, →AX = →PB + →QC + →RA becomes X − A = (B − P) + (C − Q) + (A − R) = (A + B + C) − (P + Q + R). Hence |AX| = |(A + B + C) − (P + Q + R)|.

gpt-5.title: Parametrize P,Q,R and simplify
gpt-5.body: Let P = D + u1, Q = E + u2, R = F + u3 with |u1| = |u2| = |u3| = 1 (since |→DP| = |→EQ| = |→FR| = 1). For internal 1:3 division, D = (3A + B)/4, E = (3B + C)/4, F = (3C + A)/4, so D + E + F = A + B + C. Therefore X − A = (A + B + C) − (P + Q + R) = (D + E + F) − (D + u1 + E + u2 + F + u3) = −(u1 + u2 + u3). Thus |AX| = |u1 + u2 + u3|.

gpt-5.title: Maximize |AX| and deduce PQR
gpt-5.body: The sum of three unit vectors has maximum magnitude 3, achieved iff u1, u2, u3 are parallel and equal. Hence at maximum, u1 = u2 = u3 = w (|w| = 1), so P = D + w, Q = E + w, R = F + w. Thus triangle PQR is a translate of triangle DEF, so S = area(DEF).

gpt-5.title: Coordinate setup and area of DEF

claude-opus-4.5.title: Set up coordinate system
claude-opus-4.5.body:
Place the equilateral triangle ABC with side length 4 in a coordinate system.
Let A = (0, 0), B = (4, 0), C = (2, 2√3).

Find points D, E, F that divide segments in ratio 1:3:
- D divides AB in ratio 1:3: D = (1, 0)
- E divides BC in ratio 1:3: E = B + (1/4)(C - B) = (4, 0) + (1/4)(-2, 2√3) = (7/2, √3/2)
- F divides CA in ratio 1:3: F = C + (1/4)(A - C) = (2, 2√3) + (1/4)(-2, -2√3) = (3/2, 3√3/2)

claude-opus-4.5.title: Express vectors PB, QC, RA
claude-opus-4.5.body:
Let P = D + (cos α, sin α) = (1 + cos α, sin α) where |DP| = 1
Let Q = E + (cos β, sin β) = (7/2 + cos β, √3/2 + sin β) where |EQ| = 1
Let R = F + (cos γ, sin γ) = (3/2 + cos γ, 3√3/2 + sin γ) where |FR| = 1

Calculate:
- PB = B - P = (4, 0) - (1 + cos α, sin α) = (3 - cos α, -sin α)
- QC = C - Q = (2, 2√3) - (7/2 + cos β, √3/2 + sin β) = (-3/2 - cos β, 3√3/2 - sin β)
- RA = A - R = (0, 0) - (3/2 + cos γ, 3√3/2 + sin γ) = (-3/2 - cos γ, -3√3/2 - sin γ)

claude-opus-4.5.title: Calculate AX and find maximum condition
claude-opus-4.5.body:
AX = PB + QC + RA
AX = (3 - cos α - 3/2 - cos β - 3/2 - cos γ, -sin α + 3√3/2 - sin β - 3√3/2 - sin γ)
AX = (-cos α - cos β - cos γ, -sin α - sin β - sin γ)

Let u = (cos α, sin α), v = (cos β, sin β), w = (cos γ, sin γ)
Then AX = -(u + v + w)

|AX| = |u + v + w| is maximized when u, v, w are all parallel (same direction).
Maximum |AX| = 3 when α = β = γ = θ for some θ.

claude-opus-4.5.title: Find the direction for maximum
claude-opus-4.5.body:
When α = β = γ = θ:
|AX|² = (cos α + cos β + cos γ)² + (sin α + sin β + sin γ)²
= (3cos θ)² + (3sin θ)² = 9

So |AX|_max = 3 for any θ. The maximum is achieved when all three unit vectors point in the same direction.

For the problem, we need to find when |AX| is maximum. This occurs when α = β = γ.

claude-opus-4.5.title: Calculate positions of P, Q, R at maximum
claude-opus-4.5.body:
At maximum, let α = β = γ = θ:
- P = (1 + cos θ, sin θ)
- Q = (7/2 + cos θ, √3/2 + sin θ)
- R = (3/2 + cos θ, 3√3/2 + sin θ)

The triangle PQR is a translation of triangle DEF by vector (cos θ, sin θ).

Since PQR is congruent to DEF, we need to find the area of triangle DEF.

D = (1, 0), E = (7/2, √3/2), F = (3/2, 3√3/2)

gemini-3-pro.title: Analyze the vector equation for AX
gemini-3-pro.body: Given $\overrightarrow{AX} = \overrightarrow{PB} + \overrightarrow{QC} + \overrightarrow{RA}$. We can rewrite the vectors on the RHS using points $D, E, F$. Specifically, $\overrightarrow{PB} = \overrightarrow{PD} + \overrightarrow{DB} = -\overrightarrow{DP} + \overrightarrow{DB}$, and similarly for $Q$ and $R$. Thus, $\overrightarrow{AX} = (\overrightarrow{DB} + \overrightarrow{EC} + \overrightarrow{FA}) - (\overrightarrow{DP} + \overrightarrow{EQ} + \overrightarrow{FR})$.

gemini-3-pro.title: Evaluate the sum of fixed vectors
gemini-3-pro.body: Points $D, E, F$ divide sides $AB, BC, CA$ in ratio 1:3. Thus, vectors $\overrightarrow{DB} = \frac{3}{4}\overrightarrow{AB}$, $\overrightarrow{EC} = \frac{3}{4}\overrightarrow{BC}$, and $\overrightarrow{FA} = \frac{3}{4}\overrightarrow{CA}$. Their sum is $\frac{3}{4}(\overrightarrow{AB} + \overrightarrow{BC} + \overrightarrow{CA}) = \frac{3}{4}(\vec{0}) = \vec{0}$. Therefore, the equation simplifies to $\overrightarrow{AX} = -(\overrightarrow{DP} + \overrightarrow{EQ} + \overrightarrow{FR})$.

gemini-3-pro.title: Maximize the magnitude of AX
gemini-3-pro.body: We want to maximize $|\overrightarrow{AX}| = |\overrightarrow{DP} + \overrightarrow{EQ} + \overrightarrow{FR}|$. Given $|\overrightarrow{DP}| = |\overrightarrow{EQ}| = |\overrightarrow{FR}| = 1$, the sum of these unit vectors is maximized when they point in the same direction. Let this direction be $\vec{u}$. Then $\overrightarrow{DP} = \overrightarrow{EQ} = \overrightarrow{FR} = \vec{u}$.

gemini-3-pro.title: Relate area of PQR to DEF
gemini-3-pro.body: With $\overrightarrow{DP} = \overrightarrow{EQ} = \overrightarrow{FR} = \vec{u}$, the positions of $P, Q, R$ are translations of $D, E, F$ by the vector $\vec{u}$. Specifically, $\overrightarrow{OP} = \overrightarrow{OD} + \vec{u}$, etc. Translation preserves area, so the area of triangle $PQR$ ($S$) is equal to the area of triangle $DEF$.

gemini-3-pro.title: Calculate the area of triangle DEF
gemini-3-pro.body:
The area of equilateral triangle $ABC$ with side 4 is $4\sqrt{3}$. Triangle $DEF$ is obtained by removing triangles $ADF$, $BED$, and $CFE$ from $ABC$. 
Using the side ratio 1:3: 
$AD = \frac{1}{4}AB$, $AF = \frac{3}{4}AC$ (since $F$ divides $CA$ 1:3). Area($ADF$) = $\frac{1}{2} \cdot AD \cdot AF \sin(60^\circ)$.
Ratio Area($ADF$)/Area($ABC$) = $\frac{1}{4} \cdot \frac{3}{4} = \frac{3}{16}$.
By symmetry, Area($BED$) and Area($CFE$) are also $\frac{3}{16}$ of Area($ABC$).
Thus, Area($DEF$) = $(1 - 3 \cdot \frac{3}{16}) \text{Area}(ABC) = \frac{7}{16} \cdot 4\sqrt{3} = \frac{7\sqrt{3}}{4}$.

gemini-3-pro.title: Calculate the final value
gemini-3-pro.body:
We have $S = \frac{7\sqrt{3}}{4}$. We need to find $16S^2$.
$S^2 = \frac{49 \cdot 3}{16} = \frac{147}{16}$.
$16S^2 = 16 \cdot \frac{147}{16} = 147$.

grok-4-fast.title: Place triangle and find D, E, F coordinates
grok-4-fast.body: Position equilateral triangle ABC with side 4: A(0,0), B(4,0), C(2, 2√3). D divides AB in 1:3 (AD:DB=1:3), so D = (3A + B)/4 = (1,0). E divides BC in 1:3 (BE:EC=1:3), so E = (3B + C)/4 = (3.5, 0.5√3). F divides CA in 1:3 (CF:FA=1:3), so F = (3C + A)/4 = (1.5, 1.5√3).

grok-4-fast.title: Express vector condition and |AX|
grok-4-fast.body: From \overrightarrow{AX} = \overrightarrow{PB} + \overrightarrow{QC} + \overrightarrow{RA}, derive X - A = A + B + C - (P + Q + R). Thus |AX| = |(A+B+C) - S|, where S = P + Q + R. Let V = A + B + C = (6, 2√3). P = D + U, Q = E + V, R = F + W with |U|=|V|=|W|=1, so S = C_0 + T, C_0 = D + E + F = V, T = U + V + W. Hence |AX| = |T|, and max |T| = 3 when U, V, W align.

grok-4-fast.title: Configuration for maximum |AX|
grok-4-fast.body: Maximum |AX| = 3 occurs when U = V = W = \hat{u} (unit vector). Then P = D + \hat{u}, Q = E + \hat{u}, R = F + \hat{u}, so triangle PQR is translation of DEF, with same area S = area of DEF.
